cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Turning west-northwest tonight then northwest on Friday, tracking toward the central-southeastern Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City, LA / central Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River westward to Cameron, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City; Storm-Surge Warning: Mouth of the Atchafalaya River to Shell Beach
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from the Texas-Louisiana border eastward to coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–50 mph) possible Saturday with a 33 % peak chance; low (4 %) chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible along the adjacent Cameron/Calcasieu coastline and into Calcasieu Lake.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential 6–10 inches with locally higher totals leading to flash and urban flooding around Lake Charles.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands and river flooding of the Calcasieu River.
